list_definition.definition: so smooth as to cause slipping

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The path is slippery – watch out!

list_ex_of_english: I tremble to think of children forced to bicycle or walk all that way on a cold, slippery morning.
The roads are made up in such a manner now that they are not fit for horses to go on; they are too slippery.
A patch of sidewalk briefly turns slippery even though it is dry and clean - causing the man running away with a stolen briefcase to slip.
We are holding a slippery fish, in my view, and it is getting out of our hands.
Indeed, the book is polemical - but any reader will recognize that it is a very good critical synthesis of a slippery ideology.
The family remains a slippery thing : hard to define and yet pregnant with possibility for the historian of almost any aspect of social, cultural and economic life.
My information shows that the arrangements for dealing with roads made slippery by wintry conditions are generally satisfactory in the recent cold weather.
I agree that these are slippery notions and a standard of comparison would be extremely useful here.
